column4: amd/64 10.10 reinstall after failed upgrade to 11.04..... i have to hit escape during boot, otherwise the system hangs... grub appears and shows a 38.13 kernel as first choice (this hangs) second and booting is 35-32.65...... dpkg -l | grep linux-image-2 does NOT show the hanging kernel , further the system says that grub is NOT installed.... i am unable to do ati upgrades and suspect the kernel issue is the cause.... how do i remove the newest kerne
you should finish the upgrade
that is NOT currently possible... i am unable to d/l the appropriat files... FAP will be invoked  :(
what is FAP
Fair Access Policy... i am off grid and using wild blue satellite.
what happens if you run "update-grub"
it says grub is NOT installed
does it actually say that or are you paraphrasing
says it is not installed an offers to install it.
pastebin "dpkg --get-selections"
here ya go.. paste #  841202/
paste.ubuntu.com.... just like it says at the top of the channel
and that is showing you do have grub installed
apologies.... i was unaware of alternate paste sites..... yes it does now...as i have just done an install of grub.... would you like a paste of update grub now?
sure
here ya go... http://paste.ubuntu.com/841206/
you will see the offending *.38.13  that i am trying to remove
ok you can go ahead and delete the 2.6.38 files in /boot/
and then re-run update-grub
so simple... ok... wait one.
done and done... will reboot and see how it goes... Thank YOU for your time and effort!
